p:
The clinical manifestations of SARS include hypoxia, cyanosis, high fever (above 38 °C), accelerated breathing or respiratory distress syndrome, and shortness of breath. X-rays show changes to the lungs to varying degrees. The WHO case definition (2003) includes the following: (1) fever higher than 38 °C or history of such in the past 2 days, (2) radiological evidence of new infiltrates consistent with pneumonia, (3) chills, cough, malaise, myalgia, or known history of exposure, and (4) positive test for SARS-CoV by one or more assays.
